getActivities.title: Get all Activities assigned to a particular User
getActivities.description: Returns all Activities assigned to a particular User.

getUserCallLogs.title: Get all call logs assigned to a particular user
getUserCallLogs.description: Returns all call logs assigned to a particular user

getCurrencies.title: Get all supported currencies
getCurrencies.description: Returns all supported currencies in given account which should be used when saving monetary values with other objects. The `code` parameter of the returning objects is the currency code according to ISO 4217 for all non-custom currencies.

getDeals.title: Get all deals
getDeals.description: Returns all deals. For more information on how to get all deals, see this tutorial.

searchDeals.title: Search deals
searchDeals.description: Searches all Deals by title, notes and/or custom fields. This endpoint is a wrapper of /v1/itemSearch with a narrower OAuth scope. Found Deals can be filtered by Person ID and Organization ID.

getDealsByName.title: Find deals by name
getDealsByName.description:
This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /v1/deals/search or /v1/itemSearch instead.
Searches all deals by their title.

getDealsSummary.title: Get deals summary
getDealsSummary.description: Returns summary of all the deals.

getDealsTimeline.title: Get deals timeline
getDealsTimeline.description: Returns open and won deals, grouped by defined interval of time set in a date-type dealField (`field_key`) -- e.g. when month is the chosen interval, and 3 months are asked starting from  January 1st, 2012, deals are returned grouped into 3 groups -- January, February and March -- based on the value of the given `field_key`.

getDealActivities.title: List activities associated with a deal
getDealActivities.description: Lists activities associated with a deal.

getDealFiles.title: List files attached to a deal
getDealFiles.description: Lists files associated with a deal.

getDealFollowers.title: List followers of a deal
getDealFollowers.description: Lists the followers of a deal.

getDealMailMessages.title: List mail messages associated with a deal
getDealMailMessages.description: Lists mail messages associated with a deal.

getDealParticipants.title: List participants of a deal
getDealParticipants.description: Lists participants associated with a deal.

getDealUsers.title: List permitted users
getDealUsers.description: List users permitted to access a deal

getDealPersons.title: List all persons associated with a deal
getDealPersons.description: Lists all persons associated with a deal, regardless of whether the person is the primary contact of the deal, or added as a participant.

getDealProducts.title: List products attached to a deal
getDealProducts.description: Lists products attached to a deal.

getDealFields.title: Get all deal fields
getDealFields.description: Returns data about all deal fields

getFilterHelpers.title: Get all filter helpers
getFilterHelpers.description: Returns all supported filter helpers. It helps to know what conditions and helpers are available when you want to add or update filters. For more information on how filter's helpers can be used, see this tutorial.

getGlobalMessages.title: Get global messages
getGlobalMessages.description: Returns data about global messages to display for the authorized user.

getGoals.title: Find goals
getGoals.description: Returns data about goals based on criteria. For searching, append `{searchField}={searchValue}` to the URL, where `searchField` can be any one of the lowest-level fields in dot-notation (e.g. `type.params.pipeline_id`; `title`). `searchValue` should be the value you are looking for on that field. Additionally, `is_active=<true|false>` can be provided to search for only active/inactive goals. When providing `period.start`, `period.end` must also be provided and vice versa.

getGoalResult.title: Get result of a goal
getGoalResult.description: Gets progress of a goal for specified period.

searchItem.title: Perform a search from multiple item types
searchItem.description: Performs a search from your choice of item types and fields.

searchItemByField.title: Perform a search using a specific field from an item type
searchItemByField.description: Performs a search from the values of a specific field. Results can either be the distinct values of the field (useful for searching autocomplete field values), or the IDs of actual items (Deals, Persons, Organizations or Products).

getLeads.title: Get all leads
getLeads.description: Returns multiple Leads. Leads are sorted by the time they were created, from oldest to newest. Pagination can be controlled using `limit` and `start` query parameters. If a Lead contains custom fields, the fields' values will be included in the response in the same format as with the `Deals` endpoints. If a custom field's value hasn't been set for the Lead, it won't appear in the response. Please note that Leads do not have a separate set of custom fields, instead they inherit the custom fields' structure from Deals.

getLeadLabels.title: Get all lead labels
getLeadLabels.description: Returns details of all Lead Labels. This endpoint does not support pagination and all Labels are always returned.

getLeadSources.title: Get all lead sources
getLeadSources.description: Returns all Lead Sources. Please note that the list of Lead Sources is fixed, it cannot be modified. All Leads created through the Public Pipedrive API will have a Lead Source `API` assigned.

getMailThreads.title: Get mail threads
getMailThreads.description: Returns mail threads in specified folder ordered by most recent message within.

getMailThreadMessages.title: Get all mail messages of mail thread
getMailThreadMessages.description: Get mail messages inside specified mail thread.

getNoteComments.title: Get all comments for a note
getNoteComments.description: Returns all comments associated with a Note.

getNoteFields.title: Get all note fields
getNoteFields.description: Returns data about all note fields

searchOrganization.title: Search organizations
searchOrganization.description: Searches all Organizations by name, address, notes and/or custom fields. This endpoint is a wrapper of /v1/itemSearch with a narrower OAuth scope.

getOrganizationByName.title: Find organizations by name
getOrganizationByName.description:
This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /v1/organizations/search or /v1/itemSearch instead.
Searches all organizations by their name.

getOrganizationActivities.title: List activities associated with an organization
getOrganizationActivities.description: Lists activities associated with an organization.

getOrganizationDeals.title: List deals associated with an organization
getOrganizationDeals.description: Lists deals associated with an organization.

getOrganizationFiles.title: List files attached to an organization
getOrganizationFiles.description: Lists files associated with an organization.

getOrganizationFollowers.title: List followers of an organization
getOrganizationFollowers.description: Lists the followers of an organization.

getOrganizationMailMessages.title: List mail messages associated with an organization
getOrganizationMailMessages.description: Lists mail messages associated with an organization.

getOrganizationUsers.title: List permitted users
getOrganizationUsers.description: List users permitted to access an organization

getOrganizationPersons.title: List persons of an organization
getOrganizationPersons.description: Lists persons associated with an organization.

getOrganizationFields.title: Get all organization fields
getOrganizationFields.description: Returns data about all organization fields

getOrganizationRelationships.title: Get all relationships for organization
getOrganizationRelationships.description: Gets all of the relationships for a supplied organization ID.

getPermissionSetAssignments.title: List Permission Set assignments
getPermissionSetAssignments.description: The list of assignments for a Permission Set

searchPersons.title: Search persons
searchPersons.description: Searches all Persons by name, email, phone, notes and/or custom fields. This endpoint is a wrapper of /v1/itemSearch with a narrower OAuth scope. Found Persons can be filtered by Organization ID.

findPersonByName.title: Find persons by name
findPersonByName.description:
This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /v1/persons/search or /v1/itemSearch instead.
Searches all persons by their name.

getPersonActivities.title: List activities associated with a person
getPersonActivities.description: Lists activities associated with a person.

getPersonDeals.title: List deals associated with a person
getPersonDeals.description: Lists deals associated with a person.

getPersonFiles.title: List files attached to a person
getPersonFiles.description: Lists files associated with a person.

getPersonFollowers.title: List followers of a person
getPersonFollowers.description: Lists the followers of a person.

getPersonMailMessages.title: List mail messages associated with a person
getPersonMailMessages.description: Lists mail messages associated with a person.

getPersonUsers.title: List permitted users
getPersonUsers.description: List users permitted to access a person

getPersonProducts.title: List products associated with a person
getPersonProducts.description: Lists products associated with a person.

getPersonFields.title: Get all person fields
getPersonFields.description: Returns data about all person fields

getPipelineConversionStatistics.title: Get deals conversion rates in pipeline
getPipelineConversionStatistics.description: Returns all stage-to-stage conversion and pipeline-to-close rates for given time period.

getPipelineDeals.title: Get deals in a pipeline
getPipelineDeals.description: Lists deals in a specific pipeline across all its stages

getPipelineMovementStatistics.title: Get deals movements in pipeline
getPipelineMovementStatistics.description: Returns statistics for deals movements for given time period.

searchProducts.title: Search products
searchProducts.description: Searches all Products by name, code and/or custom fields. This endpoint is a wrapper of /v1/itemSearch with a narrower OAuth scope.

findProductsByName.title: Find products by name
findProductsByName.description:
This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /v1/products/search or /v1/itemSearch instead.
Returns data about the products that were found. If currency was set in request, prices in that currency are served back.

getProductDeals.title: Get deals where a product is attached to
getProductDeals.description: Returns data about deals that have a product attached to.

getProductFiles.title: List files attached to a product
getProductFiles.description: Lists files associated with a product.

getProductFollowers.title: List followers of a product
getProductFollowers.description: Lists the followers of a Product

getProductUsers.title: List permitted users
getProductUsers.description: Lists users permitted to access a product.

getProductFields.title: Get all product fields
getProductFields.description: Returns data about all product fields

getRecents.title: Get recents
getRecents.description: Returns data about all recent changes occured after given timestamp.

search.title: Perform a search
search.description:
This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /v1/itemSearch instead.
Performs a search across the account and returns SearchResults.

searchByField.title: Perform a search using a specific field value
searchByField.description:
This endpoint is deprecated. Please use /v1/itemSearch/field instead.
Performs a search from a specific field's values. Results can be either the distinct values of the field (useful for searching autocomplete field values), or actual items IDs (deals, persons, organizations or products).

getStageDeals.title: Get deals in a stage
getStageDeals.description: Lists deals in a specific stage.

getSubscriptionPayments.title: Get all payments of a Subscription
getSubscriptionPayments.description: Returns all payments of an installment or recurring Subscription.

getTeams.title: Get all teams
getTeams.description: Returns data about teams within the company

getTeamUsers.title: Get all users in a team
getTeamUsers.description: Returns list of all user IDs within a team

getUsers.title: Get all users
getUsers.description: Returns data about all users within the company

getCurrentUser.title: Get current user data
getCurrentUser.description: Returns data about an authorized user within the company with bound company data: company ID, company name, and domain. Note that the `locale` property means 'Date/number format' in the Pipedrive account settings, not the chosen language.

getUserFollowers.title: List followers of a user
getUserFollowers.description: Lists followers of a specific user.

getUserPermissions.title: List user permissions
getUserPermissions.description: List aggregated permissions over all assigned permission sets for a user

getUserRoleAssignments.title: List role assignments
getUserRoleAssignments.description: List role assignments for a user

getUserRoleSettings.title: List user role settings
getUserRoleSettings.description: List settings of user's assigned role

getUserConnections.title: Get all user connections
getUserConnections.description: Returns data about all connections for authorized user.

getUserSettings.title: List settings of an authorized user
getUserSettings.description: List settings of an authorized user. Example response contains a shortened list of settings.

getWebhooks.title: Get all webhooks
getWebhooks.description: Returns data about all webhooks of a company.

addActivity.title: Add an Activity
addActivity.description: Adds a new Activity. Includes `more_activities_scheduled_in_context` property in response's `additional_data` which indicates whether there are more undone Activities scheduled with the same Deal, Person or Organization (depending on the supplied data). For more information on how to add an Activity, see this tutorial.

getActivity.title: Get details of an Activity
getActivity.description: Returns details of a specific Activity

updateActivity.title: Edit an Activity
updateActivity.description: Modifies an Activity. Includes `more_activities_scheduled_in_context` property in response's `additional_data` which indicates whether there are more undone activities scheduled with the same Deal, Person or Organization (depending on the supplied data).

addActivityType.title: Add new ActivityType
addActivityType.description: Adds a new ActivityType and returns it upon success.

deleteCallLog.title: Delete a call log
deleteCallLog.description: Deletes a call log. If there is an audio recording attached to it, it will also be deleted. The related activity will not be removed by this request. If you want to remove the related activities, please use the endpoint which is specific for activities.

getCallLog.title: Get details of a call log
getCallLog.description: Returns details of a specific call log

addCallLogAudioFile.title: Attach an audio file to the call log
addCallLogAudioFile.description: Adds an audio recording to the call log. That audio can be played by those who have access to the call log object.

addDeal.title: Add a deal
addDeal.description: Adds a new deal. Note that you can supply additional custom fields along with the request that are not described here. These custom fields are different for each Pipedrive account and can be recognized by long hashes as keys. To determine which custom fields exists, fetch the dealFields and look for `key` values. For more information on how to add a deal, see this tutorial.

getDeal.title: Get details of a deal
getDeal.description: Returns details of a specific deal. Note that this also returns some additional fields which are not present when asking for all deals - such as deal age and stay in pipeline stages. Also note that custom fields appear as long hashes in the resulting data. These hashes can be mapped against the `key` value of dealFields. For more information on how to get all details of a deal, see this tutorial.

updateDeal.title: Update a deal
updateDeal.description: Updates the properties of a deal. For more information on how to update a deal, see this tutorial.

addDealFollower.title: Add a follower to a deal
addDealFollower.description: Adds a follower to a deal.

deleteDealFollower.title: Delete a follower from a deal
deleteDealFollower.description: Deletes a follower from a deal.

mergeDeals.title: Merge two deals
mergeDeals.description: Merges a deal with another deal. For more information on how to merge two deals, see this tutorial.

addDealParticipant.title: Add a participant to a deal
addDealParticipant.description: Adds a participant to a deal.

deleteDealParticipant.title: Delete a participant from a deal
deleteDealParticipant.description: Deletes a participant from a deal.

addDealProduct.title: Add a product to the deal, eventually creating a new item called a deal-product
addDealProduct.description: Adds a product to the deal.

updateDealProduct.title: Update product attachment details of the deal-product (a product already attached to a deal)

deleteDealProduct.title: Delete an attached product from a deal
deleteDealProduct.description: Deletes a product attachment from a deal, using the `product_attachment_id`.

addDealField.title: Add a new deal field
addDealField.description: Adds a new deal field. For more information on adding a new custom field, see this tutorial.

deleteDealFields.title: Delete multiple deal fields in bulk

getDealField.title: Get one deal field
getDealField.description: Returns data about a specific deal field.

deleteDealField.title: Delete a deal field
deleteDealField.description: Marks a field as deleted. For more information on how to delete a custom field, see this tutorial.

updateDealField.title: Update a deal field
updateDealField.description: Updates a deal field. See an example of updating custom fields' values in this tutorial.

addFile.title: Add file
addFile.description: Lets you upload a file and associate it with Deal, Person, Organization, Activity or Product. For more information on how to add a file, see this tutorial.

addFileAndLinkIt.title: Create a remote file and link it to an item
addFileAndLinkIt.description: Creates a new empty file in the remote location (`googledrive`) that will be linked to the item you supply. For more information on how to add a remote file, see this tutorial.

linkFileToItem.title: Link a remote file to an item
linkFileToItem.description: Links an existing remote file (`googledrive`) to the item you supply. For more information on how to link a remote file, see this tutorial.

getFile.title: Get one file
getFile.description: Returns data about a specific file.

updateFile.title: Update file details
updateFile.description: Updates the properties of a file.

addFilter.title: Add a new filter
addFilter.description: Adds a new filter, returns the ID upon success. Note that in the conditions JSON object only one first-level condition group is supported, and it must be glued with 'AND', and only two second level condition groups are supported of which one must be glued with 'AND' and the second with 'OR'. Other combinations do not work (yet) but the syntax supports introducing them in future. For more information on how to add a new filter, see this tutorial.

getFilter.title: Get one filter
getFilter.description: Returns data about a specific filter. Note that this also returns the condition lines of the filter.

deleteGlobalMessage.title: Dismiss a global message
deleteGlobalMessage.description: Removes global message from being shown, if message is dismissible

addGoal.title: Add a new goal
addGoal.description: Adds a new goal. Along with adding a new goal, a report is created to track the progress of your goal.

addLead.title: Add a lead
addLead.description: Creates a Lead. A Lead always has to be linked to a Person or an Organization or both. All Leads created through the Pipedrive API will have a Lead Source `API` assigned. Here's the tutorial for adding a Lead. If a Lead contains custom fields, the fields' values will be included in the response in the same format as with the `Deals` endpoints. If a custom field's value hasn't been set for the Lead, it won't appear in the response. Please note that Leads do not have a separate set of custom fields, instead they inherit the custom fields' structure from Deals. See an example given in the updating custom fields' values tutorial.

getLead.title: Get one lead
getLead.description: Returns details of a specific Lead. If a Lead contains custom fields, the fields' values will be included in the response in the same format as with the `Deals` endpoints. If a custom field's value hasn't been set for the Lead, it won't appear in the response. Please note that Leads do not have a separate set of custom fields, instead they inherit the custom fields' structure from Deals.

updateLead.title: Update a lead
updateLead.description: Updates one or more properties of a Lead. Only properties included in the request will be updated. Send `null` to unset a property (applicable for example for `value`, `person_id` or `organization_id`). If a Lead contains custom fields, the fields' values will be included in the response in the same format as with the `Deals` endpoints. If a custom field's value hasn't been set for the Lead, it won't appear in the response. Please note that Leads do not have a separate set of custom fields, instead they inherit the custom fields' structure from Deals. See an example of updating custom fields' values in this tutorial.

updateLeadLabel.title: Update a lead label
updateLeadLabel.description: Updates one or more properties of a Lead Label. Only properties included in the request will be updated.

getMailMessage.title: Get one mail message
getMailMessage.description: Returns data about specific mail message.

updateMailThreadDetails.title: Update mail thread details
updateMailThreadDetails.description: Updates the properties of a mail thread.

getNote.title: Get one note
getNote.description: Returns details about a specific note.

addNoteComment.title: Add a comment to a note
addNoteComment.description: Adds a new comment to a note.

updateCommentForNote.title: Update a comment related to a note
updateCommentForNote.description: Updates a comment related to a note.

deleteComment.title: Delete a comment related to a note

addOrganization.title: Add an organization
addOrganization.description: Adds a new organization. Note that you can supply additional custom fields along with the request that are not described here. These custom fields are different for each Pipedrive account and can be recognized by long hashes as keys. To determine which custom fields exists, fetch the organizationFields and look for `key` values. For more information on how to add an organization, see this tutorial.

getOrganization.title: Get details of an organization
getOrganization.description: Returns details of an organization. Note that this also returns some additional fields which are not present when asking for all organizations. Also note that custom fields appear as long hashes in the resulting data. These hashes can be mapped against the `key` value of organizationFields.

updateOrganization.title: Update an organization
updateOrganization.description: Updates the properties of an organization.

addOrganizationFollower.title: Add a follower to an organization
addOrganizationFollower.description: Adds a follower to an organization.

deleteOrganizationFollower.title: Delete a follower from an organization
deleteOrganizationFollower.description: Deletes a follower from an organization. You can retrieve the `follower_id` from the List followers of an organization endpoint.

mergeOrganizations.title: Merge two organizations
mergeOrganizations.description: Merges an organization with another organization. For more information on how to merge two organizations, see this tutorial.

addOrganizationField.title: Add a new organization field
addOrganizationField.description: Adds a new organization field. For more information on adding a new custom field, see this tutorial.

deleteOrganizationFields.title: Delete multiple organization fields in bulk

getOrganizationField.title: Get one organization field
getOrganizationField.description: Returns data about a specific organization field.

deleteOrganizationField.title: Delete an organization field
deleteOrganizationField.description: Marks a field as deleted. For more information on how to delete a custom field, see this tutorial.

updateOrganizationField.title: Update an organization field
updateOrganizationField.description: Updates an organization field. See an example of updating custom fields' values in this tutorial.

addOrganizationRelationship.title: Create an organization relationship
addOrganizationRelationship.description: Creates and returns an organization relationship.

deleteOrganizationRelationship.title: Delete an organization relationship
deleteOrganizationRelationship.description: Deletes an organization relationship and returns the deleted id.

getOrganizationRelationship.title: Get one organization relationship
getOrganizationRelationship.description: Finds and returns an organization relationship from its ID.

updateOrganizationRelationship.title: Update an organization relationship
updateOrganizationRelationship.description: Updates and returns an organization relationship.

addPerson.title: Add a person
addPerson.description: Adds a new person. Note that you can supply additional custom fields along with the request that are not described here. These custom fields are different for each Pipedrive account and can be recognized by long hashes as keys. To determine which custom fields exists, fetch the personFields and look for `key` values.

getPerson.title: Get details of a person
getPerson.description: Returns details of a person. Note that this also returns some additional fields which are not present when asking for all persons. Also note that custom fields appear as long hashes in the resulting data. These hashes can be mapped against the `key` value of personFields.

updatePerson.title: Update a person
updatePerson.description: Updates the properties of a person. For more information on how to update a person, see this tutorial.

addPersonFollower.title: Add a follower to a person
addPersonFollower.description: Adds a follower to a person.

deletePersonFollower.title: Deletes a follower from a person.
deletePersonFollower.description: Delete a follower from a person

mergePersons.title: Merge two persons
mergePersons.description: Merges a person with another person. For more information on how to merge two persons, see this tutorial.

addPersonPicture.title: Add person picture
addPersonPicture.description: Add a picture to a person. If a picture is already set, the old picture will be replaced. Added image (or the cropping parameters supplied with the request) should have an equal width and height and should be at least 128 pixels. GIF, JPG and PNG are accepted. All added images will be resized to 128 and 512 pixel wide squares.

addPersonField.title: Add a new person field
addPersonField.description: Adds a new person field. For more information on adding a new custom field, see this tutorial.

deletePersonFields.title: Delete multiple person fields in bulk

getPersonField.title: Get one person field
getPersonField.description: Returns data about a specific person field.

deletePersonField.title: Delete a person field
deletePersonField.description: Marks a field as deleted. For more information on how to delete a custom field, see this tutorial.

updatePersonField.title: Update a person field
updatePersonField.description: Updates a person field. See an example of updating custom fields' values in this tutorial.

getPipeline.title: Get one pipeline
getPipeline.description: Returns data about a specific pipeline. Also returns the summary of the deals in this pipeline across its stages.

addProduct.title: Add a product
addProduct.description: Adds a new product to the Products inventory. For more information on how to add a product, see this tutorial.

getProduct.title: Get one product
getProduct.description: Returns data about a specific product.

addProductFollower.title: Add a follower to a product
addProductFollower.description: Adds a follower to a product.

deleteProductFollower.title: Delete a follower from a product
deleteProductFollower.description: Deletes a follower from a product.

deleteProductFields.title: Delete multiple product fields in bulk

addProductField.title: Add a new product field
addProductField.description: Adds a new product field. For more information on adding a new custom field, see this tutorial.

deleteProductField.title: Delete a product field
deleteProductField.description: Marks a field as deleted. For more information on how to delete a custom field, see this tutorial.

getProductField.title: Get one product field
getProductField.description: Returns data about a specific product field.

updateProductField.title: Update a product field
updateProductField.description: Updates a product field. See an example of updating custom fields' values in this tutorial.

addStage.title: Add a new stage
addStage.description: Adds a new stage, returns the ID upon success.

getStage.title: Get one stage
getStage.description: Returns data about a specific stage.

updateStage.title: Update stage details
updateStage.description: Updates the properties of a stage.

getSubscription.title: Get details of a subscription
getSubscription.description: Returns details of an installment or a recurring Subscription.

deleteSubscription.title: Delete a subscription
deleteSubscription.description: Marks an installment or a recurring Subscription as deleted.

findSubscriptionByDeal.title: Find subscription by deal
findSubscriptionByDeal.description: Returns details of an installment or a recurring Subscription by Deal ID.

addTeam.title: Add a new team
addTeam.description: Adds a new team to the company and returns the created object

getTeam.title: Get a single team
getTeam.description: Returns data about a specific team

updateTeam.title: Update a team
updateTeam.description: Updates an existing team and returns the updated object

addTeamUser.title: Add users to a team
addTeamUser.description: Adds users to an existing team

deleteTeamUser.title: Delete users from a team
deleteTeamUser.description: Deletes users from an existing team

getUserTeams.title: Get all teams of a user
getUserTeams.description: Returns data about all teams which have specified user as a member

addUser.title: Add a new user
addUser.description: Adds a new user to the company, returns the ID upon success.

getUser.title: Get one user
getUser.description: Returns data about a specific user within the company

updateUser.title: Update user details
updateUser.description: Updates the properties of a user. Currently, only `active_flag` can be updated.

deleteUserRoleAssignment.title: Delete a role assignment
deleteUserRoleAssignment.description: Delete a role assignment for a user

addUserRoleAssignment.title: Add role assignment
addUserRoleAssignment.description: Add role assignment for a user

addWebhook.title: Create a new webhook
addWebhook.description: Creates a new webhook and returns its details. Note that specifying an event which triggers the webhook combines 2 parameters - `event_action` and `event_object`. E.g., use `*.*` for getting notifications about all events, `added.deal` for any newly added deals, `deleted.persons` for any deleted persons, etc. See https://pipedrive.readme.io/docs/guide-for-webhooks for more details.
